newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican Coffee Confederation to launch "Calicafe".
newsitem.headline: Mexican Coffee Confederation to launch "Calicafe".

text.p: The Confederation of Mexican Coffee Growers plans to launch a sister association next week that will aim to promote quality Mexican beans to world markets.

"Calicafe" will be launched May 15 by growers from the confederation and will be affiliated to the U.S.-based Specialty Coffee Association, confederation spokesman Juan Carlos Villarreal told Reuters.

Calicafe, open to all Mexican growers of quality beans, will aim to market Mexican coffee better, Villarreal said. Leading Mexican growers including Alfredo Moises Ceja, the president of the confederation, will be at the launch.
Currently, Mexican beans are uniformly sold at punitive price differentials because of traditional notions of inferior quality compared to other arabicas, such as Colombian beans.
((--Chris Aspin, Mexico City newsroom +525 7289530)) E-mail at chris.aspin@reuters.com
